ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: 0-1 on regular weeks, 8-12 when papers were due
About 5 hours/ week- mostly reading, but more when writing the papers

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: I really enjoyed this course. I think this course should be a requirement for all public health students to take because it really exposes you to a basic backdrop regarding public health philosophy and ethics. That being said, I really liked the small class size we had because I felt it was a lot more engaging.

I think it would have been useful to focus a larger percentage of the course on the applications of ethical theory to public health topics, and devote fewer classes to introduction to ethical theory. I liked the essay assignments (discussing ethics in relation to a novel).

Interesting discussion on ethics and I learned a lot of material. It might help to have main points of the lectures on a slideshow. Sometimes it was hard to determine what was important in every lecture.
Great class. Interesting to have a different way to think about public health!

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Bruce Jennings  Dr. Jennings is amazing. He's really inspiration in all the work he does, and is a wonderful and engaging lecturer. I would have enjoyed more further development on some of the later topics, but also understood that we had a limited amount of time to go through a great amount of material this semester.

Instructor: Bruce Jennings  Dr. Jennings obviously knows quite a bit about ethics, especially as applied to public health. His lectures are very informal, which is good but can make it difficult to follow sometimes.

Instructor: Bruce Jennings  Bruce is a wonderfully knowledgeable, kind, and compassionate instructor. He is so wise and sincere. I really loved this course! It provides an important fundamental understanding of how public policies are structured and what is important to consider in any practical application. Classes like this, I believe, should be taken by all students.

Instructor: Bruce Jennings  Fabulous teacher. I like having a teacher that isn't from a specifically public health/science background because it's nice to have a different perspective. Also, it's nice to have a teacher that is actually working in the field.

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Yes--take it! It is a wonderful introduction to public health ethics, and Dr.Jennings is brilliant!
A decent, low work load class for anyone interested in ethics.
Very interesting class. I believe it really rounds out the complete educational experience.
Yes, I found that discussing the role of ethics in public health is not discussed often enough in the MPH program, and this course provided an opportunity to do so.
